description:
A summary of the most interesting stories in the past 24 hours that challenge the prevailing orthodoxy about the ‘climate emergency’, public health ‘crises’ and the supposed moral defects of Western civilisation.

The post News Round-Up appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: News Round-Up

description:
In a dark day for freedom of speech, BitChute, the video hosting service, has suspended its UK operations as a result of the Online Safety Act. Will WhatsApp, Telegram and Signal be next?

The post BitChute Discontinues its Video Hosting Service in the UK, Blames Online Safety Act appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: BitChute Discontinues its Video Hosting Service in the UK, Blames Online Safety Act

description:
London is no longer one of the top five wealthiest cities in the world after losing more millionaires than anywhere else, including Moscow, owing to steep tax rises, among other reasons.

The post London Falls Out of Top Five Wealthiest Cities as Millionaires Leave appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: London Falls Out of Top Five Wealthiest Cities as Millionaires Leave

description:
The UK Government is developing a pre-crime 'murder prediction' programme which it hopes can use personal data of those known to the authorities to identify the people most likely to become killers. What could go wrong?

The post UK Creating Pre-Crime ‘Murder Prediction’ Tool to Identify People Most Likely to Kill appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: UK Creating Pre-Crime ‘Murder Prediction’ Tool to Identify People Most Likely to Kill

description:
German journalist David Bendels has been sentenced to seven months' probation for a meme poking fun at the Interior Minister's lack of commitment to free speech. Irony is truly dead, murdered by 'liberal' authoritarianism.

The post German Journalist Sentenced to Seven Months’ Probation for Meme Poking Fun at the Interior Minister’s Lack of Commitment to Free Speech appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: German Journalist Sentenced to Seven Months’ Probation for Meme Poking Fun at the Interior Minister’s Lack of Commitment to Free Speech

description:
Labour has dropped its plans for five local grooming gang inquiries that it promised in January when under pressure, saying it's now up to local councils to decide how to spend the £5 million allocated.

The post Labour Drops Plans for Rape Gang Inquiries appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Labour Drops Plans for Rape Gang Inquiries

description:
The UK Met Office has been caught reporting invented data from even more non-existent weather stations. New photographs show Newton Rigg weather station is closed, but the Met Office is still reporting readings from it!

The post Met Office Shock: More Non-Existent UK Weather Stations Discovered Reporting Invented Data appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Met Office Shock: More Non-Existent UK Weather Stations Discovered Reporting Invented Data

description:
Why is the UK in constant decline while Singapore thrives? What lessons does the one-time British city-state have for the UK? Prof Peter Coclanis and Dr Tilak Doshi have an idea: its leaders aren't bleeding heart liberals.

The post Why Singapore Thrives While the UK is in Constant Decline appeared first on The Daily Sceptic.
title: Why Singapore Thrives While the UK is in Constant Decline
